title: App Icon - Image and Title Check

AND we have current information about the expected app icon name and appearance (from TPM/Design)

WHEN observe the App Icon 
AND the title of the App
custom_expected: THEN we see the correct image and the app title appears as expected

title: Side Load - Install Fresh and Hard Quit
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have access to the latest Prod-facing build in test
AND the MLB.TV app is not installed on our device
AND we have access to a Premium Account
custom_steps:
WHEN we install the build
AND we log in with a Premium Account
AND we exit the app via tap the remote/controller Home button to return to device's Home screen
AND we quit the app via Settings > Applications > Manage Applications > Force Stop
AND we relaunch the app
custom_expected:
THEN the app launches as expected to the expected view
AND the user is logged in to the same account

title: Verify: MLB.TV can be accessed while the device is connected wirelessly

custom_expected: THEN the MLB.TV app will open successfully

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt in newsletter
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account page
User has a test email account that can be accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an email address
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number
AND confirm password
custom_expected:
THEN the app logs the user in 
AND advances to the In-Game alerts page
AND the user's email account is set to receive the newsletter

To confirm this, user must send opted-in email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been tagged with opt-in group “428” (which may be an invalid group but out of scope for client-side testing)

--

Example:

Hi DB Admin,

Can you please help me verify that an account created by our tvOS MLB.tv app has successfully opted in to receive MLB.com Newsletters?

Though there is an open issue about this group code, for the purposes of this test I am checking to make sure that one user successfully opted into opt-in group “428” and that the other did not.

camlbtest@qsss.com - opt in
cdsf33@mlbtest.com - no opt in

Please let me know if you need any more information, and thanks in advance for the help.

[Your Name]

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt out of newsletter
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account page
User has a test email account that can be accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an email address
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number
AND confirm password
custom_expected:
THEN the app logs the user in 
AND advances to the In-Game alerts page
AND the user's email account does not show an opt-in to receive the newsletter

To confirm this, user must send the email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been NOT tagged with opt-in group “428” (which may be an invalid group but out of scope for client-side testing)

--

Example:

Hi DB Admin,

Can you please help me verify that an account created by our tvOS MLB.tv app has successfully opted in to receive MLB.com Newsletters?

Though there is an open issue about this group code, for the purposes of this test I am checking to make sure that one user successfully opted into opt-in group “428” and that the other did not.

camlbtest@qsss.com - opt in
cdsf33@mlbtest.com - no opt in

Please let me know if you need any more information, and thanks in advance for the help.

[Your Name]

_Password too simple - Password must at east one character, one number, one uppercase letter and one lowercase letter_

title: In-game alerts Menu
custom_preconds: User is viewing the Settings menu and In-game alerts are set to Off
custom_steps:
1. Activate In-game alerts button
2. Set 1st alert to ON
3. Back out to Settings
4. Observe In-game alerts button
5. Repeat steps 1-4 but set the next alert set to ON until all are set to ON
6. Repeat steps 1-4 but set the next alert set to OFF until all are set to OFF
custom_expected:
* When one or more alerts are set to ON, the In-game alerts button should display as ON
* When all Notifications are set to OFF, the button should display as OFF
* All alert buttons can navigated to and selected
* Page navigation is as expected (disabled L/R from all alert buttons, disabled up from top and down from bottom alerts)
* All alerts can be set to ON/OFF 

_Note: Functionality to be tested in the Notifications section_

title: Alert Persistence
custom_preconds: App installed (does not have to be fresh) & launched, Welcome Placard dismissed, user observing In-game alerts menu in Settings
custom_steps:
